definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: With love at first sight, our hearts are linked, changing the moment into eternal love.
sentences.chinese: 只是一见钟情，两颗心已相通，刹那化成永恒情浓。

sentences.english: That there's no such thing as love at first sight or first kiss.
sentences.chinese: 世界上没有一见钟情或一吻定情这种事。

sentences.english: She was five years ago, and Lee Hyun-Prince Edward meet by chance, love at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 她五年前和李贤太子萍水相逢，一见钟情。

sentences.english: You always fall in love with women with beautiful eyes!
sentences.chinese: 你老是对电眼美女一见钟情。

sentences.english: Snowster on the Surge in love at first sight Maoruo angel.
sentences.chinese: 唐伯虎对貌若天仙的秋香一见钟情。

sentences.english: Is there really love at first sight?
sentences.chinese: 这个世界上真的存在一见钟情吗？

sentences.english: Looked at romantically, though, it could be evidence of "love at first sight".
sentences.chinese: 虽然从浪漫的角度看，这或许是“一见钟情”的证据。

sentences.english: I loved him at the first sight.
It is love at first sight, and they spend the night dancing and talking.
sentences.chinese: 他们一见钟情，整个晚上都在跳舞，交谈。

sentences.english: Maybe you do not know me, no matter. One see clock emotionis pop.
sentences.chinese: 也许你还不认识我，没有关系，一见钟情很流行。

sentences.english: They are all so beautiful and fantacy that you will be love them at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 它们都是那么美好和迷人，会让你一见钟情的。

sentences.english: A man's neediness stems from falling in love at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 男人的需求源于一见钟情。

sentences.english: The building reveals its preciousness at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 建筑具有让人一见钟情的可贵品质。

sentences.english: In sum, Ivan fell in love with her at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，依凡对她一见钟情。

sentences.english: Maybe udo not know me, no matter, one see clock emotion is pop.
sentences.chinese: 也许也还不认识我，不过不打紧，一见钟情很流行。

sentences.english: When I first saw him, it was love at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 当我第一次见到他时，我可是一见钟情。

definition: to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: to get to know each other/acquaintance
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
